SENT.plain: Maternal cortical vein thrombosis is a potentially fatal complication of pregnancy and the puerperium
Patients may present with focal neurologic deficits, seizures, or symptoms indicating increased intracranial pressure
Associated conditions include maternal dehydration and preeclampsia or frank eclampsia
Parturients may require anesthesia for various types of delivery
Safe administration of appropriate anesthesia must take into account the possible presence of a coagulopathy or reduced intracranial compliance

Case presentations, a literature review, possible pathogenetic mechanisms, and specific anesthetic considerations are discussed to enable the obstetric anesthesiologist to develop a rational plan of management
